rooms.description: A welcoming entrance with traditional Kerala stone arches and wooden beams.
An open space adorned with intricate wood carvings, designed to align with Vastu principles favoring a central living area.
A dining space adjacent to the kitchen, featuring traditional Kerala motifs.
Well-equipped kitchen area with a view of the garden, designed for efficient workflow and local cooking traditions.
Master bedroom placed in the east to align with Vastu principles, ensuring positive energy flow.
Secondary bedroom designed for privacy and relaxation.
Additional bedroom, ensuring the familyâ€™s space requirements are met.
Fourth bedroom with ample natural light and ventilation.
Fifth bedroom offering additional space for family members or guests.
Sixth bedroom designed for extended family living and adaptability.
A dedicated library space with ample shelving and natural lighting, placed in the north to harness positive energy as per Vastu.

openings.description: Main entrance door oriented towards the west for better air circulation and to balance energies according to Vastu.
Secondary door providing access from the living area towards the garden and service areas.
Window designed for optimal daylight in the library, enhancing the reading environment.
Window in the master bedroom to allow morning sunlight and positive energy flow.

vastu_advice.notes: The design integrates Vastu principles by positioning key living areas like the library in the north, and placing important spaces such as the master bedroom towards the east. The irregularity of the plot is accommodated through flexible room placements while ensuring traditional Kerala aesthetics.

local_national_norms.description: The plan respects local building norms, including setback requirements, open space regulations, and traditional architectural elements characteristic of Kerala design.
